14#ifndef DNS_RESOLVER_H
15#define DNS_RESOLVER_H 1
16
17/*****
18 ***** Module Info
19 *****/
20
21/*! \file dns/resolver.h
22 *
23 * \brief
24 * This is the BIND 9 resolver, the module responsible for resolving DNS
25 * requests by iteratively querying authoritative servers and following
26 * referrals. This is a "full resolver", not to be confused with
27 * the stub resolvers most people associate with the word "resolver".
28 * The full resolver is part of the caching name server or resolver
29 * daemon the stub resolver talks to.
30 *
31 * MP:
32 *\li The module ensures appropriate synchronization of data structures it
33 * creates and manipulates.
34 *
35 * Reliability:
36 *\li No anticipated impact.
37 *
38 * Resources:
39 *\li TBS
40 *
41 * Security:
42 *\li No anticipated impact.
43 *
44 * Standards:
45 *\li RFCs: 1034, 1035, 2181, TBS
46 *\li Drafts: TBS
47 */
48
49#include <inttypes.h>
50#include <stdbool.h>
51
52#include <isc/lang.h>
53#include <isc/socket.h>
54#include <isc/stats.h>
55
56#include <dns/types.h>
57#include <dns/fixedname.h>
58
59ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
60
61/*%
62 * A dns_fetchevent_t is sent when a 'fetch' completes. Any of 'db',
63 * 'node', 'rdataset', and 'sigrdataset' may be bound. It is the
64 * receiver's responsibility to detach before freeing the event.
65 * \brief
66 * 'rdataset', 'sigrdataset', 'client' and 'id' are the values that were
67 * supplied when dns_resolver_createfetch() was called. They are returned
68 * to the caller so that they may be freed.
69 */
70typedef struct dns_fetchevent {
71 ISC_EVENT_COMMON(struct dns_fetchevent);
72 dns_fetch_t * fetch;
73 isc_result_t result;
74 dns_rdatatype_t qtype;
75 dns_db_t * db;
76 dns_dbnode_t * node;
77 dns_rdataset_t * rdataset;
78 dns_rdataset_t * sigrdataset;
79 dns_fixedname_t foundname;
80 const isc_sockaddr_t * client;
81 dns_messageid_t id;
82 isc_result_t vresult;
83} dns_fetchevent_t;
84
85/*%
86 * The two quota types (fetches-per-zone and fetches-per-server)
87 */
88typedef enum {
89 dns_quotatype_zone = 0,
90 dns_quotatype_server
91} dns_quotatype_t;
92
93/*
94 * Options that modify how a 'fetch' is done.
95 */
96#define DNS_FETCHOPT_TCP 0x00000001 /*%< Use TCP. */
97#define DNS_FETCHOPT_UNSHARED 0x00000002 /*%< See below. */
98#define DNS_FETCHOPT_RECURSIVE 0x00000004 /*%< Set RD? */
99#define DNS_FETCHOPT_NOEDNS0 0x00000008 /*%< Do not use EDNS. */
100#define DNS_FETCHOPT_FORWARDONLY 0x00000010 /*%< Only use forwarders. */
101#define DNS_FETCHOPT_NOVALIDATE 0x00000020 /*%< Disable validation. */
102#define DNS_FETCHOPT_EDNS512 0x00000040 /*%< Advertise a 512 byte
103 UDP buffer. */
104#define DNS_FETCHOPT_WANTNSID 0x00000080 /*%< Request NSID */
105#define DNS_FETCHOPT_PREFETCH 0x00000100 /*%< Do prefetch */
106#define DNS_FETCHOPT_NOCDFLAG 0x00000200 /*%< Don't set CD flag. */
107#define DNS_FETCHOPT_NONTA 0x00000400 /*%< Ignore NTA table. */
108/* RESERVED ECS 0x00000000 */
109/* RESERVED ECS 0x00001000 */
110/* RESERVED ECS 0x00002000 */
111/* RESERVED TCPCLIENT 0x00004000 */
112#define DNS_FETCHOPT_NOCACHED 0x00008000 /*%< Force cache update. */
113#define DNS_FETCHOPT_QMINIMIZE 0x00010000 /*%< Use qname
114 minimization. */
115#define DNS_FETCHOPT_QMIN_STRICT 0x00020000 /*%< Do not work around
116 servers that return
117 errors on non-empty
118 terminals. */
119#define DNS_FETCHOPT_QMIN_SKIP_IP6A 0x00040000 /*%< Skip some labels
120 when doing qname
121 minimization on
122 ip6.arpa. */
123#define DNS_FETCHOPT_NOFORWARD 0x00080000 /*%< Do not use forwarders
124 if possible. */
125
126/* Reserved in use by adb.c 0x00400000 */
127#define DNS_FETCHOPT_EDNSVERSIONSET 0x00800000
128#define DNS_FETCHOPT_EDNSVERSIONMASK 0xff000000
129#define DNS_FETCHOPT_EDNSVERSIONSHIFT 24
130
131/*
132 * Upper bounds of class of query RTT (ms). Corresponds to
133 * dns_resstatscounter_queryrttX statistics counters.
134 */
135#define DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS0 10
136#define DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS0STR "10"
137#define DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS1 100
138#define DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS1STR "100"
139#define DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS2 500
140#define DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS2STR "500"
141#define DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS3 800
142#define DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS3STR "800"
143#define DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS4 1600
144#define DNS_RESOLVER_QRYRTTCLASS4STR "1600"
145
146/*
147 * XXXRTH Should this API be made semi-private? (I.e.
148 * _dns_resolver_create()).
149 */
150
151#define DNS_RESOLVER_CHECKNAMES 0x01
152#define DNS_RESOLVER_CHECKNAMESFAIL 0x02
153
154#define DNS_QMIN_MAXLABELS 7
155#define DNS_QMIN_MAX_NO_DELEGATION 3
156#define DNS_MAX_LABELS 127
157
158isc_result_t
159dns_resolver_create(dns_view_t *view,
160 isc_taskmgr_t *taskmgr,
161 unsigned int ntasks, unsigned int ndisp,
162 isc_socketmgr_t *socketmgr,
163 isc_timermgr_t *timermgr,
164 unsigned int options,
165 dns_dispatchmgr_t *dispatchmgr,
166 dns_dispatch_t *dispatchv4,
167 dns_dispatch_t *dispatchv6,
168 dns_resolver_t **resp);
169
170/*%<
171 * Create a resolver.
172 *
173 * Notes:
174 *
175 *\li Generally, applications should not create a resolver directly, but
176 * should instead call dns_view_createresolver().
177 *
178 * Requires:
179 *
180 *\li 'view' is a valid view.
181 *
182 *\li 'taskmgr' is a valid task manager.
183 *
184 *\li 'ntasks' > 0.
185 *
186 *\li 'socketmgr' is a valid socket manager.
187 *
188 *\li 'timermgr' is a valid timer manager.
189 *
190 *\li 'dispatchv4' is a dispatch with an IPv4 UDP socket, or is NULL.
191 * If not NULL, 'ndisp' clones of it will be created by the resolver.
192 *
193 *\li 'dispatchv6' is a dispatch with an IPv6 UDP socket, or is NULL.
194 * If not NULL, 'ndisp' clones of it will be created by the resolver.
195 *
196 *\li resp != NULL && *resp == NULL.
197 *
198 * Returns:
199 *
200 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS On success.
201 *
202 *\li Anything else Failure.
203 */
204
205void
206dns_resolver_freeze(dns_resolver_t *res);
207/*%<
208 * Freeze resolver.
209 *
210 * Notes:
211 *
212 *\li Certain configuration changes cannot be made after the resolver
213 * is frozen. Fetches cannot be created until the resolver is frozen.
214 *
215 * Requires:
216 *
217 *\li 'res' is a valid resolver.
218 *
219 * Ensures:
220 *
221 *\li 'res' is frozen.
222 */
223
224void
225dns_resolver_prime(dns_resolver_t *res);
226/*%<
227 * Prime resolver.
228 *
229 * Notes:
230 *
231 *\li Resolvers which have a forwarding policy other than dns_fwdpolicy_only
232 * need to be primed with the root nameservers, otherwise the root
233 * nameserver hints data may be used indefinitely. This function requests
234 * that the resolver start a priming fetch, if it isn't already priming.
235 *
236 * Requires:
237 *
238 *\li 'res' is a valid, frozen resolver.
239 */
240
241
242void
243dns_resolver_whenshutdown(dns_resolver_t *res, isc_task_t *task,
244 isc_event_t **eventp);
245/*%<
246 * Send '*eventp' to 'task' when 'res' has completed shutdown.
247 *
248 * Notes:
249 *
250 *\li It is not safe to detach the last reference to 'res' until
251 * shutdown is complete.
252 *
253 * Requires:
254 *
255 *\li 'res' is a valid resolver.
256 *
257 *\li 'task' is a valid task.
258 *
259 *\li *eventp is a valid event.
260 *
261 * Ensures:
262 *
263 *\li *eventp == NULL.
264 */
265
266void
267dns_resolver_shutdown(dns_resolver_t *res);
268/*%<
269 * Start the shutdown process for 'res'.
270 *
271 * Notes:
272 *
273 *\li This call has no effect if the resolver is already shutting down.
274 *
275 * Requires:
276 *
277 *\li 'res' is a valid resolver.
278 */
279
280void
281dns_resolver_attach(dns_resolver_t *source, dns_resolver_t **targetp);
282
283void
284dns_resolver_detach(dns_resolver_t **resp);
285
286isc_result_t
287dns_resolver_createfetch(dns_resolver_t *res, const dns_name_t *name,
288 dns_rdatatype_t type,
289 const dns_name_t *domain, dns_rdataset_t *nameservers,
290 dns_forwarders_t *forwarders,
291 const isc_sockaddr_t *client, dns_messageid_t id,
292 unsigned int options, unsigned int depth,
293 isc_counter_t *qc, isc_task_t *task,
294 isc_taskaction_t action, void *arg,
295 dns_rdataset_t *rdataset,
296 dns_rdataset_t *sigrdataset,
297 dns_fetch_t **fetchp);
298/*%<
299 * Recurse to answer a question.
300 *
301 * Notes:
302 *
303 *\li This call starts a query for 'name', type 'type'.
304 *
305 *\li The 'domain' is a parent domain of 'name' for which
306 * a set of name servers 'nameservers' is known. If no
307 * such name server information is available, set
308 * 'domain' and 'nameservers' to NULL.
309 *
310 *\li 'forwarders' is unimplemented, and subject to change when
311 * we figure out how selective forwarding will work.
312 *
313 *\li When the fetch completes (successfully or otherwise), a
314 * #DNS_EVENT_FETCHDONE event with action 'action' and arg 'arg' will be
315 * posted to 'task'.
316 *
317 *\li The values of 'rdataset' and 'sigrdataset' will be returned in
318 * the FETCHDONE event.
319 *
320 *\li 'client' and 'id' are used for duplicate query detection. '*client'
321 * must remain stable until after 'action' has been called or
322 * dns_resolver_cancelfetch() is called.
323 *
324 * Requires:
325 *
326 *\li 'res' is a valid resolver that has been frozen.
327 *
328 *\li 'name' is a valid name.
329 *
330 *\li 'type' is not a meta type other than ANY.
331 *
332 *\li 'domain' is a valid name or NULL.
333 *
334 *\li 'nameservers' is a valid NS rdataset (whose owner name is 'domain')
335 * iff. 'domain' is not NULL.
336 *
337 *\li 'forwarders' is NULL.
338 *
339 *\li 'client' is a valid sockaddr or NULL.
340 *
341 *\li 'options' contains valid options.
342 *
343 *\li 'rdataset' is a valid, disassociated rdataset.
344 *
345 *\li 'sigrdataset' is NULL, or is a valid, disassociated rdataset.
346 *
347 *\li fetchp != NULL && *fetchp == NULL.
348 *
349 * Returns:
350 *
351 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS Success
352 *\li #DNS_R_DUPLICATE
353 *\li #DNS_R_DROP
354 *
355 *\li Many other values are possible, all of which indicate failure.
356 */
357
358void
359dns_resolver_cancelfetch(dns_fetch_t *fetch);
360/*%<
361 * Cancel 'fetch'.
362 *
363 * Notes:
364 *
365 *\li If 'fetch' has not completed, post its FETCHDONE event with a
366 * result code of #ISC_R_CANCELED.
367 *
368 * Requires:
369 *
370 *\li 'fetch' is a valid fetch.
371 */
372
373void
374dns_resolver_destroyfetch(dns_fetch_t **fetchp);
375/*%<
376 * Destroy 'fetch'.
377 *
378 * Requires:
379 *
380 *\li '*fetchp' is a valid fetch.
381 *
382 *\li The caller has received the FETCHDONE event (either because the
383 * fetch completed or because dns_resolver_cancelfetch() was called).
384 *
385 * Ensures:
386 *
387 *\li *fetchp == NULL.
388 */
389
390void
391dns_resolver_logfetch(dns_fetch_t *fetch, isc_log_t *lctx,
392 isc_logcategory_t *category, isc_logmodule_t *module,
393 int level, bool duplicateok);
394/*%<
395 * Dump a log message on internal state at the completion of given 'fetch'.
396 * 'lctx', 'category', 'module', and 'level' are used to write the log message.
397 * By default, only one log message is written even if the corresponding fetch
398 * context serves multiple clients; if 'duplicateok' is true the suppression
399 * is disabled and the message can be written every time this function is
400 * called.
401 *
402 * Requires:
403 *
404 *\li 'fetch' is a valid fetch, and has completed.
405 */
406
407dns_dispatchmgr_t *
408dns_resolver_dispatchmgr(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
409
410dns_dispatch_t *
411dns_resolver_dispatchv4(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
412
413dns_dispatch_t *
414dns_resolver_dispatchv6(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
415
416isc_socketmgr_t *
417dns_resolver_socketmgr(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
418
419isc_taskmgr_t *
420dns_resolver_taskmgr(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
421
422uint32_t
423dns_resolver_getlamettl(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
424/*%<
425 * Get the resolver's lame-ttl. zero => no lame processing.
426 *
427 * Requires:
428 *\li 'resolver' to be valid.
429 */
430
431void
432dns_resolver_setlamettl(dns_resolver_t *resolver, uint32_t lame_ttl);
433/*%<
434 * Set the resolver's lame-ttl. zero => no lame processing.
435 *
436 * Requires:
437 *\li 'resolver' to be valid.
438 */
439
440unsigned int
441dns_resolver_nrunning(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
442/*%<
443 * Return the number of currently running resolutions in this
444 * resolver. This is may be less than the number of outstanding
445 * fetches due to multiple identical fetches, or more than the
446 * number of of outstanding fetches due to the fact that resolution
447 * can continue even though a fetch has been canceled.
448 */
449
450isc_result_t
451dns_resolver_addalternate(dns_resolver_t *resolver, const isc_sockaddr_t *alt,
452 const dns_name_t *name, in_port_t port);
453/*%<
454 * Add alternate addresses to be tried in the event that the nameservers
455 * for a zone are not available in the address families supported by the
456 * operating system.
457 *
458 * Require:
459 * \li only one of 'name' or 'alt' to be valid.
460 */
461
462void
463dns_resolver_setudpsize(dns_resolver_t *resolver, uint16_t udpsize);
464/*%<
465 * Set the EDNS UDP buffer size advertised by the server.
466 */
467
468uint16_t
469dns_resolver_getudpsize(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
470/*%<
471 * Get the current EDNS UDP buffer size.
472 */
473
474void
475dns_resolver_reset_algorithms(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
476/*%<
477 * Clear the disabled DNSSEC algorithms.
478 */
479
480void
481dns_resolver_reset_ds_digests(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
482/*%<
483 * Clear the disabled DS/DLV digest types.
484 */
485
486isc_result_t
487dns_resolver_disable_algorithm(dns_resolver_t *resolver,
488 const dns_name_t *name, unsigned int alg);
489/*%<
490 * Mark the given DNSSEC algorithm as disabled and below 'name'.
491 * Valid algorithms are less than 256.
492 *
493 * Returns:
494 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
495 *\li #ISC_R_RANGE
496 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
497 */
498
499isc_result_t
500dns_resolver_disable_ds_digest(dns_resolver_t *resolver,
501 const dns_name_t *name, unsigned int digest_type);
502/*%<
503 * Mark the given DS/DLV digest type as disabled and below 'name'.
504 * Valid types are less than 256.
505 *
506 * Returns:
507 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS
508 *\li #ISC_R_RANGE
509 *\li #ISC_R_NOMEMORY
510 */
511
512bool
513dns_resolver_algorithm_supported(dns_resolver_t *resolver,
514 const dns_name_t *name, unsigned int alg);
515/*%<
516 * Check if the given algorithm is supported by this resolver.
517 * This checks whether the algorithm has been disabled via
518 * dns_resolver_disable_algorithm(), then checks the underlying
519 * crypto libraries if it was not specifically disabled.
520 */
521
522bool
523dns_resolver_ds_digest_supported(dns_resolver_t *resolver,
524 const dns_name_t *name,
525 unsigned int digest_type);
526/*%<
527 * Check if the given digest type is supported by this resolver.
528 * This checks whether the digest type has been disabled via
529 * dns_resolver_disable_ds_digest(), then checks the underlying
530 * crypto libraries if it was not specifically disabled.
531 */
532
533void
534dns_resolver_resetmustbesecure(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
535
536isc_result_t
537dns_resolver_setmustbesecure(dns_resolver_t *resolver, const dns_name_t *name,
538 bool value);
539
540bool
541dns_resolver_getmustbesecure(dns_resolver_t *resolver, const dns_name_t *name);
542
543
544void
545dns_resolver_settimeout(dns_resolver_t *resolver, unsigned int timeout);
546/*%<
547 * Set the length of time the resolver will work on a query, in milliseconds.
548 *
549 * 'timeout' was originally defined in seconds, and later redefined to be in
550 * milliseconds. Values less than or equal to 300 are treated as seconds.
551 *
552 * If timeout is 0, the default timeout will be applied.
553 *
554 * Requires:
555 * \li resolver to be valid.
556 */
557
558unsigned int
559dns_resolver_gettimeout(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
560/*%<
561 * Get the current length of time the resolver will work on a query,
562 * in milliseconds.
563 *
564 * Requires:
565 * \li resolver to be valid.
566 */
567
568void
569dns_resolver_setclientsperquery(dns_resolver_t *resolver,
570 uint32_t min, uint32_t max);
571void
572dns_resolver_setfetchesperzone(dns_resolver_t *resolver, uint32_t clients);
573
574void
575dns_resolver_getclientsperquery(dns_resolver_t *resolver, uint32_t *cur,
576 uint32_t *min, uint32_t *max);
577
578bool
579dns_resolver_getzeronosoattl(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
580
581void
582dns_resolver_setzeronosoattl(dns_resolver_t *resolver, bool state);
583
584unsigned int
585dns_resolver_getretryinterval(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
586
587void
588dns_resolver_setretryinterval(dns_resolver_t *resolver, unsigned int interval);
589/*%<
590 * Sets the amount of time, in millseconds, that is waited for a reply
591 * to a server before another server is tried. Interacts with the
592 * value of dns_resolver_getnonbackofftries() by trying that number of times
593 * at this interval, before doing exponential backoff and doubling the interval
594 * on each subsequent try, to a maximum of 10 seconds. Defaults to 800 ms;
595 * silently capped at 2000 ms.
596 *
597 * Requires:
598 * \li resolver to be valid.
599 * \li interval > 0.
600 */
601
602unsigned int
603dns_resolver_getnonbackofftries(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
604
605void
606dns_resolver_setnonbackofftries(dns_resolver_t *resolver, unsigned int tries);
607/*%<
608 * Sets the number of failures of getting a reply from remote servers for
609 * a query before backing off by doubling the retry interval for each
610 * subsequent request sent. Defaults to 3.
611 *
612 * Requires:
613 * \li resolver to be valid.
614 * \li tries > 0.
615 */
616
617unsigned int
618dns_resolver_getoptions(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
619/*%<
620 * Get the resolver options.
621 *
622 * Requires:
623 * \li resolver to be valid.
624 */
625
626void
627dns_resolver_addbadcache(dns_resolver_t *resolver, const dns_name_t *name,
628 dns_rdatatype_t type, isc_time_t *expire);
629/*%<
630 * Add a entry to the bad cache for <name,type> that will expire at 'expire'.
631 *
632 * Requires:
633 * \li resolver to be valid.
634 * \li name to be valid.
635 */
636
637bool
638dns_resolver_getbadcache(dns_resolver_t *resolver, const dns_name_t *name,
639 dns_rdatatype_t type, isc_time_t *now);
640/*%<
641 * Check to see if there is a unexpired entry in the bad cache for
642 * <name,type>.
643 *
644 * Requires:
645 * \li resolver to be valid.
646 * \li name to be valid.
647 */
648
649void
650dns_resolver_flushbadcache(dns_resolver_t *resolver, const dns_name_t *name);
651/*%<
652 * Flush the bad cache of all entries at 'name' if 'name' is non NULL.
653 * Flush the entire bad cache if 'name' is NULL.
654 *
655 * Requires:
656 * \li resolver to be valid.
657 */
658
659void
660dns_resolver_flushbadnames(dns_resolver_t *resolver, const dns_name_t *name);
661/*%<
662 * Flush the bad cache of all entries at or below 'name'.
663 *
664 * Requires:
665 * \li resolver to be valid.
666 * \li name != NULL
667 */
668
669void
670dns_resolver_printbadcache(dns_resolver_t *resolver, FILE *fp);
671/*%
672 * Print out the contents of the bad cache to 'fp'.
673 *
674 * Requires:
675 * \li resolver to be valid.
676 */
677
678void
679dns_resolver_setquerydscp4(dns_resolver_t *resolver, isc_dscp_t dscp);
680isc_dscp_t
681dns_resolver_getquerydscp4(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
682
683void
684dns_resolver_setquerydscp6(dns_resolver_t *resolver, isc_dscp_t dscp);
685isc_dscp_t
686dns_resolver_getquerydscp6(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
687/*%
688 * Get and set the DSCP values for the resolver's IPv4 and IPV6 query
689 * sources.
690 *
691 * Requires:
692 * \li resolver to be valid.
693 */
694
695void
696dns_resolver_setmaxdepth(dns_resolver_t *resolver, unsigned int maxdepth);
697unsigned int
698dns_resolver_getmaxdepth(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
699/*%
700 * Get and set how many NS indirections will be followed when looking for
701 * nameserver addresses.
702 *
703 * Requires:
704 * \li resolver to be valid.
705 */
706
707void
708dns_resolver_setmaxqueries(dns_resolver_t *resolver, unsigned int queries);
709unsigned int
710dns_resolver_getmaxqueries(dns_resolver_t *resolver);
711/*%
712 * Get and set how many iterative queries will be allowed before
713 * terminating a recursive query.
714 *
715 * Requires:
716 * \li resolver to be valid.
717 */
718
719void
720dns_resolver_setquotaresponse(dns_resolver_t *resolver,
721 dns_quotatype_t which, isc_result_t resp);
722isc_result_t
723dns_resolver_getquotaresponse(dns_resolver_t *resolver, dns_quotatype_t which);
724/*%
725 * Get and set the result code that will be used when quotas
726 * are exceeded. If 'which' is set to quotatype "zone", then the
727 * result specified in 'resp' will be used when the fetches-per-zone
728 * quota is exceeded by a fetch. If 'which' is set to quotatype "server",
729 * then the reuslt specified in 'resp' will be used when the
730 * fetches-per-server quota has been exceeded for all the
731 * authoritative servers for a zone. Valid choices are
732 * DNS_R_DROP or DNS_R_SERVFAIL.
733 *
734 * Requires:
735 * \li 'resolver' to be valid.
736 * \li 'which' to be dns_quotatype_zone or dns_quotatype_server
737 * \li 'resp' to be DNS_R_DROP or DNS_R_SERVFAIL.
738 */
739
740void
741dns_resolver_dumpfetches(dns_resolver_t *resolver,
742 isc_statsformat_t format, FILE *fp);
743
744
745#ifdef ENABLE_AFL
746/*%
747 * Enable fuzzing of resolver, changes behaviour and eliminates retries
748 */
749void dns_resolver_setfuzzing(void);
750#endif
751
752ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
753
754#endif /* DNS_RESOLVER_H */
